events.event_description: The fourth and final Vogtle nuclear plant unit entered commercial operation.
events.citation: Most of this increase was driven by costs related to the construction of the Vogtle nuclear plant operated by Georgia Power. The fourth and final Vogtle unit entered commercial operation at the end of April 2024.

events.event_description: Annual utility spending to produce and deliver electricity reached $320 billion, representing a 12% increase from 2003 levels.
events.citation: Annual spending by major utilities to produce and deliver electricity increased 12% from $287 billion in 2003 to $320 billion in 2023 as measured in real 2023 dollars, according to financial reports to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC).

events.event_description: Energy storage spending in distribution infrastructure increased dramatically from $97 million to $723 million.
events.citation: Although energy storage remains a relatively small portion of the total budget for distribution infrastructure, spending increased from $97 million in 2022 to $723 million in 2023.

events.event_description: Capital investment in line transformers increased 23% to $7.5 billion due to supply chain and manufacturing issues.
events.citation: Capital investment in line transformers, which decrease voltage to household levels, increased 23% from 2022 to $7.5 billion in 2023—a result of supply chain and manufacturing issues.

events.event_description: Distribution system spending increased by $6.5 billion to reach $50.9 billion for grid upgrades and extreme weather resilience.
events.citation: More than one-fifth of this increase occurred between 2022 and 2023 when spending increased by $6.5 billion to a total of $50.9 billion as utilities replaced and upgraded aging equipment and installed new lines, transformers, and other equipment to help neighborhood electricity grids withstand extreme weather events and to manage the intermittency of renewable resources.
